You can save even more money by paying a bit more each month, thus clearing the debt in a shorter time. By doing this you'll free up more dollars further down the line enabling you to spend them on something really nice.

In some cases the APR really skyrockets after this period but sometimes it is still a lot less than the APR for credit card purchases in your other cards, which means that a credit card balance transfer will still work for you.
What you have to remember though, is that you should not take your anger out on the credit card company as you have no divine right to expect them to let you borrow their cash just because you want it, they have to be sure that you are a worthy credit risk. To combat this, the first thing that you should not do is to apply again and again to different credit cards, credit agencies or banks for loans, this will only dig the hole deeper for yourself. The next time you apply for any type of credit it will be known that you have applied before and been rejected in the past, so they will find theyre answer easier to come by.
The average rate of interest on credit cards is generally at a minimum level of 17%. Compare this to the base rate set by the financial authorities generally at about 3 to 4% at this time of economic slowdown and it makes you wonder why and indeed how those credit card companies can do such deals as zero percent. The truth is that they know most people who cannot pay off their balances each month will sooner rather than later begin to pay interest. So they are offering short-tern introductory deals in order to attract those very borrowers to them and away from their competitors.

All There Is To Know About Credit Cards Down Below

Credit cards allow consumers to make purchases even when they are not immediately prepared to pay for those purchases. Before signing up for a new credit card, you have to learn some basic things that will help you avoid mountains of debt. Here are some ways to use your credit cards wisely so that you avoid a lot of trouble down the road.
<img src="
http://farm9.static.flickr.com/8423/7691219050_85596d7f70.jpg"; align="left" width="231" style="padding:10px;"/>
Always check all the extra fees that your credit card carries so you don't have any surprises. The card may come with additional fees and charges that make the card unbearable.

If you have more than one credit card, try to pick one to pay off every month. Even if you cannot pay all the cards off, having one that is paid in full on a monthly basis will reflect positively on your credit report.

Keep an eye on your credit report to ensure you are properly handling your accounts. It is a great way to see how others handle your accounts as well. You want to look for reporting errors. If you find an error, contact your creditor as well as the credit bureau.

Every credit card has a limit of how much money you can spend. You shouldn't exceed this limit, and limit your use of credit cards to financial emergencies. When you max out your credit card limit, it will end up hurting you, because you might not have this money to use when it's really needed.

Be vigilant of all purchases, so you can make sure not to overspend. Sometimes plastic makes it easy to lose track of your spending decisions, which can result in you owing more than you can afford to pay.

Keep a list of the "lost/stolen card" phone numbers for each of your credit card issuers along with your credit card number for reference. Make sure that it is in a separate location from your cards and secure from other people. Use this list to contact your credit card issuers if your credit cards are ever lost or stolen.

Look over your card statements thoroughly. Check each statement for any inaccuracies as well as changes you did not authorize. Report any mistakes to the credit card company as soon as possible. That can make sure you don't pay too much, and it can also help your credit score stay where it is as well.

As was mentioned above, many people often are confused and frustrated by credit cards companies. Using the right credit card for you needs will help you stay in control of your financial situation. Keep these ideas in mind in order to have a much better credit card experience.
